info.title: OPERA Cloud Integration Configuration API
info.description:
APIs catering to Integration Configuration in OPERA Cloud. Operations such as get Hotel Interface Types, or get UDF mappings can be found in this module.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 23.4.

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright (c) 2020, 2023 Oracle and/or its affiliates.

parameters.name: displayName

parameters.name: fiscalPartnerCode
parameters.description: Used for fiscal partner codes. Possible values of this pattern are 1, 101, 101.EQP, or 101.EQP.X.

parameters.description: Used for fiscal partner codes. Possible values of this pattern are 1, 101, 101.EQP, or 101.EQP.X.

parameters.name: partnerPayloadType
parameters.description: Used for searching a partner code configured with the specified fiscal payload type.

get.summary: Get the template device locations
get.description:
Use this API to get the template device locations.

OperationId:getTemplateDeviceLocations

parameters.name: fetchInactive
parameters.description: Determines wether to fetch inactive records or not.

parameters.name: codes
parameters.description: Codes to be searched.

parameters.name: wildCard
parameters.description: Wildcard search on the code.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the code.

200.description: Response object for fetching template Device locations.

post.description:
Use this API to create the template device locations.

OperationId:postTemplateDeviceLocations

parameters.name: templateDeviceLocationsCriteria
parameters.description: Request object for creating template Device locations.

Use this API to update the template device locations.

parameters.description: Unique ID of device location.

parameters.name: templateDeviceLocationsToBeChanged
parameters.description: Request object for changing template Device locations.

delete.description:
Use this API to delete the template device locations.

OperationId:removeTemplateDeviceLocations

parameters.name: deviceLocationId
parameters.description: Unique ID of device location.

parameters.description: Hotel Interface Logo. On the database, this is also referred as DBF Logo. This is a three letter code followed by an underscore(_). This tells us which DBF files and log files with the prefix that IFC7 is going to create.

get.summary: Operation to fetch interface room statuses.

parameters.name: interfaceId
parameters.description: OPERA id for Property

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: OPERA id for Property

200.description: Collection of Hotel Interface Room Statuses.

put.summary: Operation to change interface room status.

parameters.name: interfaceId
parameters.description: OPERA id for Property

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: OPERA id for Property

parameters.name: changeInterfaceRoomStatus
parameters.description: Request object for updating a Hotel Interface Room Status. If it does not exist, then creates the Hotel Interface Room Status.

200.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

delete.summary: Operation to remove interface room status.

parameters.name: interfaceId
parameters.description: OPERA id for Property

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: OPERA id for Property

parameters.name: entryCode
parameters.description: Entry code of a Hotel Interface Room Status.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Room Status which is either Vacant (V) or Occupied (O).

parameters.name: housekeepingStatus
parameters.description: Housekeeping status of a room.

parameters.name: customRoomTranslation
parameters.description: Custom Room Translation of a Hotel Interface. It is a concatenation of a Status (V-Vacant or O-Occupied) and Housekeeping Status (IS-Inspected, CL-Clean, etc.) The delimiter is a period. Sample values are V.IS, V.CL, O.IS, O.CL.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the Hotel Interface Room Status.

parameters.name: interfaceRoomStatusId
parameters.description: Row number to identify all the records belonging to a single group of Hotel Interface Room Status.

authKey.name: authorization
authKey.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

x-hotelid.name: x-hotelid
x-hotelid.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in

x-hubid.name: x-hubid
x-hubid.description: x-hubid is a logical grouping of multiple properties that allows api consumers to manage data from a group of properties. This x-hubid is a valid list of hub codes configured in OPERA to which the user has access. Rest APIs without hotelId in the operation path can support hub level integration using x-hubid

status.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

targetSchema.description: Link to the metadata of the resource, such as JSON-schema, that describes the resource expected when dereferencing the target resource..

operationId.description: The operationId of the path you can call to follow this link.  This allows you to look up not only the path and method, but the description of that path and any parameters you need to supply.

title.description: Exact copy of the "summary" field on the linked operation.

exceptionDetailType.title: Error Detail
exceptionDetailType.description: Complex type that contains error details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

o:errorDetails.description: Details of the error message, consisting of a hierarchical tree structure.

errorInstance.title: Error Instance Details
errorInstance.description: Complex type that contains error instance details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

fetchedDeliveryMethods.description: Response to request to fetch the delivery method for a property/HUB/Chain and its configurations.

deliveryMethods.description: Collection of all delivery method types.

configuredExternalDeliveryMethodsType.description: External system configuration delivery methods for a property(chain or hub).

generalDeliveryMethodType.description: General delivery method SFTPConfigurationType configuration, settings for Email and Fax Delivery of General Letters

format.description: EMAIL Format: HTML, RTF, PDF. Fax Format: TIF

type.description: Deliver Type, possible values: AR, BILLING, CONFIRMATION, LEADS, OWS, OVOS.

hotelId.description: Hotel code

activateDelivery.description: This option must be selected in order to activate emailing from an SMTP compliant email server

hTMLFormatDelivery.description: Available for Confirmation Letters only and when Activate Email Delivery is selected

format.description: EMAIL Format: HTML, RTF, PDF. Fax Format: TIF

type.description: Deliver Type, possible values: AR, BILLING, CONFIRMATION, LEADS, OWS, OVOS.

hotelId.description: Hotel code

activateEmailToFax.description: This option must be selected in order to activate faxing from an SMTP compliant fax server

sftpConfigurationType.description: Information which uniquely identifies SFTP Configuration

configurationId.description: Unique id associated with this configuration

description.description: Description of the destination, such as Shift Reports.

inactive.description: Indicates whether the configuration is inactive or not.

hotelId.description: Hotel code

queueReservationDeliveryMethodType.description: Queue reservation delivery method configuration, settings for Text Message Delivery of Queue Reservation status

userId.description: Partner or User ID, Text field for Partner ID or User ID for the delivery provider, Name of the Text Messaging Provider.

serverName.description: Text field for Service type or email server address for the SMTP.

account.description: Text field for Service ID or email account for the SMTP as advised by Text Messaging Provider.

timeOut.description: Number field for Delivery time out in seconds for the message. Any message exceeding this limit will be timed out. Add word Seconds using small grey font next to the number box.

url.description: Text field for URL address or the Text Messaging Provider.

uRLParameter.description: Url parameter(format) is supported by Text Messaging Provider, it can be either an XML or TEXT format.

format.description: Text field for entering any special formatting for the delivery, or multi select LOV type, for example the one used for Address Format for selection of SID fields, to allow users choosing from a list of tags that may be used to customize this field.

message.description: Text field for entering the Text Message for delivery.

type.description: Type of Delivery Method HTTP/SMTP: HTTP for URL, SMTP for Email

hotelId.description: Hotel code

confirmationDeliveryMethodType.description: Confirmation letter delivery method configuration, settings for Text Message, Email and Fax Delivery of Confirmation Letters

guestMessageDeliveryMethodType.description: Guest text message configuration, settings for Text Message Delivery of Guest Messages

billingFolioDeliveryMethodType.description: Billing folio delivery method configuration, settings for Email and Fax Delivery of Guest Folios

queueRushDeliveryMethodType.description: Queue rush delivery method configuration, settings for Text Message Delivery of Queue Reservation status

changeDeliveryMethods.description: Request to change the delivery method for a property/HUB/Chain and its configurations.

deliveryMethods.description: Collection of delivery method types to change.

changedDeliveryMethods.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

createDeliveryMethods.description: Request to create the delivery method for a property/HUB/Chain and its configurations.

deliveryMethods.description: Collection of delivery method types to create.

templateDeviceLocationsDetails.description: Response object for fetching template Device locations.

templateDeviceLocationsType.description: List of Device locations at template level.

translationTextType2000.description: Contains Multiple translated texts and language codes.

defaultText.description: Default text with Character length from 0 to 2000.

translatedTexts.description: List of translated text and language codes.

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 2000.

templateDeviceLocationsCriteria.description: Request object for creating template Device locations.

templateDeviceLocations.description: Template Device locations to be created.

templateDeviceLocationsToBeChanged.description: Request object for changing template Device locations.

templateDeviceLocations.description: Template Device locations to be changed.

publishers.description: Collection of publisher external systems information.

publishersType.description: Information of all the publishers for a given subscriber.

fetchedPublishers.description: Response to request to fetch the external systems

status.description: The current status of the IFC.

activeFlag.description: Indicator if the Hotel Interface is active or not. This is different from the Interface Status, which is either STOPPED or RUNNING.

uniqueID_Type.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

hotelInterfaceStatusType.description: Status of the Hotel Interface either STOPPED or RUNNING.

active.description: A flag to indicate whether the UDF mapping is active in the Interface system or not.

updateAllowed.description: A flag to indicate whether the update is allowed in the Interface system or not.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the Type for Reservation and Profile Type.

totalPages.description: Evaluated total page count based on the requested max fetch count.

offset.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

limit.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

hasMore.description: Indicates whether all the records are included in the response or not. Absence of the attribute values should be consider as all rows fetched in the response.

wakeDelay.description: Wakeup delay value of the Hotel Interface.

folioDisplayOption.description: Folio display option of the Hotel Interface applicable to VID and MSC. "0" means folio display option off. "A" means a guest folio display option. "U" means user defined folio display option.

sVTransactionType.description: Status of the Hotel Interface either STOPPED or RUNNING.

pathId1.description: Used if interface has to support more than one front office system.

displayFlag.description: True if the interface will be displayed.

autoStartFlag.description: Decides if the interface will be started automatically when the controller is restarted.

activeFlag.description: Indicator if the Hotel Interface is active or not. This is different from the Interface Status, which is either STOPPED or RUNNING.

interfaceStatus.description: Status if the Hotel Interface is STOPPED or RUNNING. This is different from the Active Flag, which is either 1 or 0.

version.description: Version no. of each external interface that is installed

nAStart.description: Indicator if the Hotel Interface handles night audit commands.

multipleRoomKey.description: Indicator if the Hotel Interface allows multiple room selection for keys.
